item.title: Destripando juegos: protecciones anti ROM Hacking
item.description: Talk at the JASyP (Jornadas de Anonimato, Seguridad y Privacidad). Organized by the group Interferencias in the University of Granada. I talked about the security mechanisms like encryption that we can find inside of the video-games with the goal to obfuscate their files to avoid hacks, mods and fan-translations.

item.title: ROM Hacking Level 01: Textos
item.description: Live streaming from the virtual reality platform AltspaceVR. The talk explains different topics and concept related to text formats like encodings, tables, fonts and compression.

item.title: ROM Hacking Level 02: Imágenes
item.description: Live streaming from Twitch requested by the TraduSquare community. This time I talked about the file format of the images, sprites and textures in video-games and all the kind of compression and techniques used in the Nintendo DS. Following this talk, the next day I did a second live streaming where the people choose three games for Nintendo DS and I had to figure out the image formats:

item.title: El misterio de las claves de Pokémon Mundo Misterioso
item.description: Talk at the DevFest 2018 organized by the GDG Jaén (Google Developer Group). The presentation is about a Twitter thread I did on July. For a week I was figuring out how the game Pokémon Mistery Dungeon Explorers of Sky from Nintendo DS generate and validate a kind of password for rescue missions, special events and object sharing. It almost a study of the assembly code of the game with some notes about the implementation.

item.title: Protocolos del Industrial IoT
item.description: Talk at the IEEE Developer Days organized by the association IEEE Student Branch of Elche. I talked about the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT) and the main network protocols and framework in the market. I gave details on how one of them, DDS, works with a demo.
